definition: certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]

sentences.english: Irrefutable evidence, we had the last one day every stronghold.
sentences.chinese: 铁证如山，我方一举拿下最后一个日伪据点。

sentences.english: ChengRuShan said irrefutable proof and what good look it up.
sentences.chinese: 程如山说铁证如山还有什么好查的。

sentences.english: The suspects' fingerprints on the safe were considered incontrovertible evidence that he had participated in the robbery.
sentences.chinese: 保险箱上嫌疑人的手纹被认为是他参与了抢劫的铁证。

sentences.english: This finally have the solid, w. connor rate return take WangXiaoGong soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 这下终于有了铁证，马戎率兵回城捉拿王小红。

sentences.english: " Because "the status quo is the iron-clad protection of ancient family than 10000 made the book much stronger.
sentences.chinese: 因为“现状就是铁证，比保古家的万言书有力得多。”

sentences.english: The invention of new weapons, that is, the importance of an iron-clad proof of this.
sentences.chinese: 新武器的发明，就是这种重要性的一个铁证”。

sentences.english: Of course, there is never an iron clad guarantee that a paroled killer will never kill again.
sentences.chinese: 当然，没有铁证可以确定假释期的犯人不会继续杀人。

sentences.english: The crimes committed by the Dalai Clique are irrefutable and pinned down by ironclad evidence.
sentences.chinese: 达赖集团的犯罪事实铁证如山，是抵赖不掉的。

sentences.english: Warming is also reinforced when shrubs move northward and replace lower tundra plants.
sentences.chinese: 气候变暖的另一铁证是灌木北移取代了苔原植物。

definition: to refuse to admit (what one has done)/to disavow/to renege
